summary: This document contains prepared testimony from a forensic examiner regarding the digital evidence analysis process for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. It details the forensic imaging and examination of hard drives (GX 54 and GX 55), the extraction of metadata from Word documents and emails, and observations about file locations that suggest intentional placement.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her user profile is mentioned as the location where several Word documents (GX 418, 420, 421, 422) were saved on the examined hard drive.

events.title: Preparation of Forensic Testimony
events.description: A forensic examiner prepares testimony detailing the process of imaging and analyzing hard drives (GX 54 and GX 55) for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

keyFacts: Forensic analysis was performed on hard drives designated as GX 54 and GX 55, which were identified as Dell computers.

Several Word documents (GX 417, 418, 420, 421, 422) were examined; GX 417 was found at the root of the C drive, an unusual location suggesting an attempt to hide it or make it easily accessible to another user.
Documents GX 418, 420, 421, and 422 were saved under Ghislaine Maxwell's user profile on the examined drive.

The testimony explains how document metadata (creation date, author, last printed) is generated and can be manipulated, such as a 'last printed' date occurring before a 'created' date if a document is printed and then saved with 'Save As'.
Emails (GX 412 and GX 415) were also confirmed to be on the hard drive GX 54.
